info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:14PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 813 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Imperial, or 7 miles west of Moon Township, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, North Side Pittsburgh, Hampton Township, Scott Township, Robinson Township, Economy, Dormont, Bellevue, Carnegie, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, Wexford, West View, and Stowe Township. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 35 and 36. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 76. Parkway North between mile markers 3 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 41 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
